GeneralInformation.School Vision: Learning School, Caring Community, Contributing Citizens
GeneralInformation.School Mission: To nurture individuals to succeed with values and purpose
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: The school strives to nurture students of fine character and to provide all students with a holistic education that prepares them well for the future. To prepare students for the 21st century workforce, inquiry and inventive thinking are promoted through team learning, collaboration and the use of Information Technology. While striving for excellence, students are also nurtured in a caring and safe environment where learning is fun. Students are inculcated with values such as integrity, respect and responsibility so that when they graduate, they are not only equipped with the skills and talents to lead productive lives, but are also imbued with good moral values and contribute back to society. This is what defines Bishan Park Secondary School (BPSS).
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Languages & Humanities: iCast â€“ Multimedia Approach to Journalism

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: The school's Learning for Life Programme (LLP), the Holistic ARTs (HART) Programme, provides all lower secondary students with a variety of learning experiences beyond the formal Art curriculum. A rich repertoire comprising six arts modules (ceramics, sculpture, digital art, music composition, instrument playing and dance) deepens appreciation and enhances knowledge and skills in the Arts. Students who demonstrate talent are provided platforms and opportunities to further hone their talents through the Visual Arts Talent Development Programme. The school was presented with the National Arts Education Glow Award (2013) by the National Arts Council in recognition of its holistic approach to Arts Education. The school's Applied Learning Programme (ALP), the iCAST Programme, allows students to apply English Language skills from various genres in an authentic setting. All lower secondary students go through the Media Studies Programme where they further hone their language skills as they engage in scripting, video-casting and storyboarding. Students also acquire related ICT skills progressively.  The iCast Programme not only facilitates the use of the English Language to communicate ideas and values and to educate the community, but also allows students to deepen their learning. Students are also offered a glimpse of the possible careers in the fields of media and broadcasting.
